bill.title: Protect American Taxpayers and Secure Border Act
bill.description: Prohibits using taxpayer funds to build a barrier intended to impede travel between Mexico and the United States, requiring such funds to come from the government of Mexico. It also authorizes the Department of Justice to appoint 100 additional immigration judges. The Department of Homeland Security shall take the actions necessary to ensure that displaced persons receive the needed humanitarian assistance.

committee.name: Subcommittee on Border Security, Facilitation, and Operations

referrals.name: Subcommittee on Border Security, Facilitation, and Operations

history.action: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
